title: Olympic National Park: NPS Centennial
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     NPS Centennial            NPS Centennial       The National Park Service turns 100 on August 25, 2016. As we lead up to the centennial, we invite you to participate in Find Your Park Experiences to learn, discover, be inspired, or simply have fun in national parks. Find Your Park Experiences offer unique opportunities to explore national parks both in person and online. Check out the experiences in this park or search all experiences to identify an opportunity that matches your interests. You can also share your national park story at FindYourPark.com. A Call to Action remains the foundation for our 2016 centennial preparations. It is the National Park Service's blueprint for the future, outlining the innovative work we want to accomplish. Olympic National Park is a big part of this effort. Take a look at what we're doing and get involved!   Experiences      Find Your World Heritage Sites in the United States  The World of World Heritage awaits. Get out and explore the 22 World Heritage Sites in the United States and see what makes these protected areas unique. Find out why the World has recognized them as being the most significant cultural and natural sites on the planet. Read more   Night Skies Over the North Cascades  Spend an evening in the wilds of North Cascades and you will rediscover the wonder of utter darkness punctuated by the countless points of light that since the dawn of time have ignited the imagination of humanity. Read more   North Olympic National Park Waterfalls  Experience the sights, sounds and sensations of Olympic's waterfalls Read more      Call to Action Projects      Olympic Workplace Enrichment Advisory Council Tackles Issues of Employee Satisfaction  In 2014 Olympic National Park Superintendent Sarah Creachbaum chartered the Olympic Workplace Enrichment Advisory Council to to address issues of workforce enrichment and engagement so that all employees feel valued, well informed, motivated, and fulfilled in their work environment. Read more   Bark Ranger Program Invites Community To Get Healthy In The Park With Their Pets  Bark Ranger program developed as a community outreach strategy and method for positive enforcement of pet policy in the park. Read more   Marine Ambassadors Program Prepares High School Students For Natural Resource Careers  Since 2013, Olympic National Park has partnered with the North Olympic Peninsula Skills Center to offer natural resource career development for local high school students in Forks and Port Angeles through the Marine Ambassador program. Read more   River Story: Community Arts Program Showcases Elwha River Restoration  The largest dam removal in United States history began September 2011 on the Elwha River in Olympic National Park.  River Story is an exhibit at the Port Angeles Public Library celebrating the Elwha River's remarkable tale of renewal, restoration, and transformation. The event provides the public with opportunities to become engaged with the Elwha River Restoration project through art, dance, poetry, family activities, storytelling and a lecture series. Read more
